questions.question_text:
A story created has an AUC of .62.

What two things could be done to possibly improve this AUC score? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Run detect sentiment on the dataflow before creating the story.
choices.A: Change the order of the story insights to descending.
choices.B: Add more rows of relevant data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
i think this one

Selected Answer: BD
B&D i think are correct

questions.question_text:
The Universal Containers Einstein Analytics team built a dashboard with two widgets:

1. List widget associated to the query Type_2" and grouped by the dimension "Type" (multi-selection)
2. Pie chart widget associated to the query "Step_pie_3" and grouped by the dimension "Type"

Additional notes:
* The queries use different datasets.
* Users should be able to choose more than one Type (multi-selection)

What is the right syntax for the binding/interaction?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Use .asobject. Since your widget allows multiple selections, it returns an array. The in operator needs an array on the right side, and .asobject makes sure that the binding value is interpreted as an array. Using .asstring would coerce the selection into a single string, which breaks the multi-select filter.
It's A i give it a try :)

Selected Answer: B
I think B.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.ja-jp.246.0.api_meta.meta/api_meta/meta_wavedashboard.htm

Selected Answer: B
I think it's B

questions.question_text:
A Tableau CRM consultant develops a dashboard called SalesPerformance_1 in a sandbox environment. To deploy the recipe, the consultant creates a package in workbench.

What is the correct meta data reference in the xml file?

The Tableau CRM team at a company creates three recipes.

1) myRecipeOne: this recipe takes 2 hours to run.
2) myRecipeTwo: this recipe takes 1 hour and 30 minutes to run.
3) myReapeThree: this recipe takes 1 minute and 30 seconds to run.

If all three recipes run, how many count towards the 24 hour rolling recipe run limit?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Tableau CRM (previously known as Einstein Analytics) has a recipe run limit where only those recipes that take longer than 5 minutes to run count toward the 24-hour rolling limit.

Given the details provided:

myRecipeOne: 2 hours (definitely longer than 5 minutes)
myRecipeTwo: 1 hour and 30 minutes (definitely longer than 5 minutes)
myReapeThree: 1 minute and 30 seconds (shorter than 5 minutes)
Only the first two recipes (myRecipeOne and myRecipeTwo) count towards the 24-hour rolling limit.

So the correct answer is:
C. 2.

Selected Answer: C
Only the third doesn't count to the limit

questions.question_text: When deploying a model to an existing Prediction, what number should be considered?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In the context of Tableau CRM (previously Einstein Analytics), when you're deploying a model to an existing Prediction, the consideration is about the number of models that can exist under a single Prediction Definition.

B. 10: Limit of number of models under a Prediction Definition

choices.B: 10: Limit of number of models under a Prediction Definition.
choices.A: 5: Limit of total number of Prediction Definitions.
choices.D: 3: Limit of total number of Models.
choices.C: 20: Limit of number of models under a Prediction Definition.
